newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-RBA says high April jobs growth a relief.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-RBA says high April jobs growth a relief.

text.p: Reserve Bank of Australia Ian Macfarlane said on Thursday he was relieved to see the 37,100 employment growth recorded for April because previous months had shown weak figures.
"It is quite a high figure, but we needed a high figure and we're relieved to see it," Macfarlane told a parliamentary committee when asked about today's jobs data.
Figures released earlier shown Australian employment rose 37,100 in April and the unemployment rate was 8.7 percent, which was much in line with market expectations.
Fulltime employment rose by 28,400 in the month.
Median forecasts had centred on a rise of a 35,000 and an unemployment rate of 8.7 percent.
